alert.note: Alert for Bulloch; Effingham (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 25 at 10:49PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM EDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Georgia, including the following counties, Bulloch and Effingham. * WHEN...Until 1245 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1046 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - The heaviest rain has shifted east of the Brooklet area where up to 3 inches of rain has fallen in the last 2 hours. The most intense rain is now impacting the Springfield and Guyton area where hourly rainfall rates of 2 to 3 inches per hour are occurring. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Springfield, Guyton, Brooklet, Stilson, Leefield, Bay, Denmark, Nevils, Arcola, Akins, Grimshaw, Hubert, Emit, Ivanhoe, Pretoria, Tusculum, Kennedy Pond and Overbrook.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 1-888-383-2024 or email your reports to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
